com.pb.sawdust.util.parsing

Class ArrayParser<I,O>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pb.sawdust.util.parsing.ArrayParser<I,O>
  • Type Parameters:
    I - The type of input array to be parsed; must be an array class.
    O - The component type of the array output by this parser.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Parser<I,O>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BinaryParser, FixedWidthStringParser, ObjectArrayParser

    public abstract class ArrayParser<I,O>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Parser<I,O>
    The ArrayParser class provides a framework for writing a Parser which parses an array of a given type into an output. Each array parser holds a series of subarray widths which indicate how to split a given input array. For example, an array parser with subarray specified as [2,1,3] will split an array (a) with six elements (a.length == 6) into three arrays: [a[0],a[1]][a[2]][a[3],a[4],a[5]], each of which will be parsed into an output. It is possible to specify an "open" (variable-width) tail array by making the final subarray widthOPEN_FINAL_SUBARRAY_WIDTH. Any array of the specified input type is considred parsable as long as its length is equal to or greater than the sum of the positive subarray widths. For a parser using a non-open final subarray, an input array which is lonmger than the sum of the positive widths will be truncated.

    Because this class parses arrays , the generic type I must be an array. Though this is not (and cannot be) explicitly enforced at construction, most methods in this class make that assumption and will throw an error if a non-array input is specified.

      • OPEN_FINAL_SUBARRAY_WIDTH

        public static final int OPEN_FINAL_SUBARRAY_WIDTH

    • Constructor Detail

      • ArrayParser

        public ArrayParser(int[] widths)
        Constructor specifying the widths of the subarrays used when parsing inputs. All widths must be greater than 0, except the final width, which may also be OPEN_FINAL_SUBARRAY_WIDTH, indicating an "open" (variable width) final subarray. An open subarray allows the final subarray to be empty if the input array's length is equal to the sum of positive widths.
        Parameters:
        widths - The widths of the subarrays resulting from the parsing of an input array.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if element in widths is less than one (final element is allowed to be equal to OPEN_FINAL_SUBARRAY_WIDTH).

      • ArrayParser

        public ArrayParser(int[] positions,
           int arrayLength)
        Constructor specifying breakpoint positions and the input array length. Widths (as used in ArrayParser(int[]) constructor) are determined implicitly by the positions. If positions[0] == 0, then the size of the output array will be positions.length, otherwise the size of the output array will be positions.length + 1 (the parsing algorithm assumes a start at input element 0). A positive arrayLength parameter determines the width of the final element as arrayLength - positions[positions.length-1]. Alternatively, the arrayLength parameter may be set to OPEN_FINAL_SUBARRAY_WIDTH, which sets the final subarray to be open (equivalent to setting the final width to OPEN_FINAL_SUBARRAY_WIDTH).
        Parameters:
        positions - The breakpoint positions for the subarrays resulting from the parsing of an input array.
        arrayLength - The minimum length of an input array, or OPEN_FINAL_SUBARRAY_WIDTH for an open final subarray.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if arrayLength != OPEN_FINAL_SUBARRAY_WIDTH and arrayLength is less than the sum of the elements in positions.

      • isParsable

        public boolean isParsable(I input)
        Determine whether the specified input can be parsed by this parser. An input array is considered parsable if input.length >= getMinLength().
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if input can be parsed, false if it cannot.
